stories.text: I'm a backend engineer who has very limited experience with mobile engineering. I would like to build an app which is simple e.g. filling forms, showing charts, register/login etc. Basic presentation layer on top of backend API. I'm looking for the quickest way to build this, preferably hybrid app which can compile to iOS & android from the same codebase. What are my best options for framework in 2021?
stories.title: Ask HK: Quickest way to develop mobile apps as back end engineer in 2021?

stories.text:
Hercules, SIMH, virtual Apollo Guidance Computer, DOSBox, and other emulators exist.

Let's assume we have the requisite tapes/source code listings (which is a non-trivial assumption). Since there's no hardware, we are stranded on ebb tide if for whatever reason we decide to run the code. What layers of computing history are the most notable and vulnerable to oblivion?
stories.title: Ask HN: What major systems have no emulators and will be lost to history?
